intro: Gigliolia subacaulis, commonly known as the slender gigliolia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its slender stem and small white or greenish flowers make it a distinctive addition to gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
